channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Coronavirus: Schools to bring back small groups of students from May 19, with focus on graduating cohort
item.description:
May 02, 2020 12:16 PM

Institutions of higher learning, particularly the Institute of Technical Education, will also allow more students to return to campus for critical consultations, projects or practicums.

item.title: Tightened circuit breaker measures extended for another week; some activities allowed to resume from May 5
item.description:
May 02, 2020 12:05 PM

Businesses like barbers, home-based bakers and laundry services will be allowed to open from May 12.

item.title: Virtual concert performances every evening as part of month-long May Day celebrations for migrant workers
item.description:
May 02, 2020 9:10 AM

SINGAPORE - Concert performances by local Tamil, Bengali and Mandarin artistes will be aired online daily through the month of May as part of the labour movement's May Day celebrations for migrant workers.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on May 2
New plans to house foreign workers to stem Covid-19
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore is moving into the next phase of its battle against the coronavirus outbreak in foreign worker dormitories, and will step up measures to monitor the workers' health and prevent recurrent transmissions there.

item.title: Courts should not be used in petty quarrels, says judge
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

The High Court, in a ruling on Wednesday, has sent a message to the management councils of more than 2,000 entities, including condominiums.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singapore's traveller restrictions under constant review
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Just as Singapore is constantly looking at whether there is a need to adjust its circuit breaker measures, it is also continuously reviewing its import controls to see if they can be updated over time, National Development Minister Lawrence Wong said yesterday.

item.title: Safe distancing may be new normal on return to workplaces
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

A safe distancing inspector in every workplace, staggered hours to prevent congregation of workers, and measures barring staff from socialising in the pantry, rest areas and during lunch breaks.

item.title: Man said to have breached stay-home notice twice
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

A man allegedly breached his stay-home notice (SHN) on two occasions after he was ordered to stay indoors between March 24 and April 7 during the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: She's Singapore's oldest Covid-19 survivor at 102
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Madam Yap Lay Hong, 102, is Singapore's oldest coronavirus survivor.

item.title: Initiatives on contact tracing to be stepped up and expanded
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Contact tracing initiatives are being stepped up, as part of plans to fight the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: 29 taken to court since circuit breaker started for virus-related offences
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

A 50-year-old man was charged in court on Thursday after he allegedly breached his stay-home notice on two occasions.

item.title: Over 300,000 meals to be provided to vulnerable groups
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 300,000 meals will be provided to vulnerable and disadvantaged groups who have been laid low by the pandemic.

item.title: Stay-home notice extended for foreign workers in construction
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

The stay-home notice (SHN) being served by around 180,000 foreign workers in the construction sector and their dependants will be extended by another 14 days as a precautionary measure to stem the spread of Covid-19, the authorities said yesterday.

item.title: Some My First Skool pupils to get fees covered for 6 months
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Low-income families with children attending NTUC First Campus (NFC) My First Skool pre-schools will have their school fees fully covered for six months if they have had a reduction in household income or job loss.

item.title: Drop off Solidarity Payment cheques at banks, advises UOB
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Singaporeans who receive their $600 Solidarity Payment by cheque are encouraged to drop it off into their banks' cheque deposit boxes as a safe and easy way of accessing their payouts.

item.title: Over 10m meals served to foreign workers confined to dorms
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 10 million meals have been served to foreign workers since some purpose-built dormitories went into lockdown, with food caterers seeking to address concerns raised about their quality and quantity.

item.title: Coronavirus: Chance of a lifetime to transform way we live for sustainable future
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

The Covid-19 pandemic has understandably superseded the issue that dominated the news, politics, business and academia for much of last year - the climate emergency.

item.title: McDonald's extends closure of Singapore outlets beyond May 5
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Singaporeans looking forward to getting their Big Mac fix next Tuesday will have to wait a little longer as McDonald's Singapore said it will be closed beyond the date.

item.title: Most dormitory residents have been paid their salaries: MOM
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Most of the migrant workers staying in dormitories have been paid their salaries during the circuit breaker period that began last month, even though many had to stop work because only essential services are allowed to operate.

item.title: Covid-19 offers preview of impact of environmental threats
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

While some people may say that the Covid-19 pandemic is pushing climate change off the front page, we see more similarities than dissimilarities.

item.title: Halimah: Home businesses a key income source for many
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Home-based businesses are an important source of income for many families, especially when the coronavirus pandemic has cut into household income, said President Halimah Yacob in a Facebook post yesterday.

item.title: 60-year-old man dies, bringing total deaths to 16
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

A 60-year-old male Singaporean died yesterday from complications due to Covid-19 infection, bringing the total deaths here to 16.

item.title: 20 credit-for-sex scam victims fined for breaching safe distancing measures
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Twenty victims of credit-for-sex scams found themselves out of pocket twice, when they were also fined for flouting circuit breaker measures in leaving their homes to procure sexual services.

item.title: Next phase in coronavirus fight entails getting recovery right
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

The next phase of Singapore's strategy to tackle the coronavirus outbreak in foreign worker dormitories will involve making sure that the recovery process is done right, said Manpower Minister Josephine Teo yesterday.

item.title: Ministers pay tribute to healthcare, essential workers
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Members of the multi-ministry task force tackling the coronavirus outbreak here paid tribute to the workforce here, in particular the healthcare workers, essential workers and migrant workers, during a press conference yesterday.

item.title: $1.3m lost to e-commerce scams in first quarter of this year
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

E-commerce scams more than doubled in the first quarter of this year, with 1,159 cases recorded, compared with 536 cases in the same period last year.

item.title: Infection rates differ widely across workers' dormitories
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

The coronavirus infection rate varies widely across foreign worker dormitories, with several hundred tests sometimes yielding only one or two positive results.

item.title: Foreign workers thanked for their contributions
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Foreign workers were thanked for their contributions by a range of Singaporeans and groups on a very different May Day yesterday.

item.title: WP calls for changes to environment for workers
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore should prepare for a post-Covid-19 future by improving the environment for workers, said the Workers' Party (WP) in its Labour Day message.

item.title: Steps taken to improve meals provided to foreign workers
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

The inter-agency task force in charge of migrant worker welfare in dormitories has received more positive feedback on the quality, quantity and timeliness of the catered meals being delivered, said its chairman Aubeck Kam yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singapore schools step up to help needy students, families
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

In many cases, teachers have also become their charges' confidants and counsellors, apart from helping them with their lessons.

item.title: Singapore works with 4 nations to resume essential cross-border travel
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Minister for Trade and Industry Chan Chun Sing and trade ministers from Australia, Canada, South Korea and New Zealand have agreed to facilitate the resumption of essential cross-border travel.

item.title: New rules at workplaces when circuit breaker eases
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

It won't be business as usual when circuit breaker measures are gradually eased. New workplace safety standards will have to be in place to protect workers from further spread of Covid-19, National Development Minister Lawrence Wong said yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singapore Parliament last met from more than one location during Sars
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Lawmakers are expected to pass the Bill allowing MPs to be spread out at different locations.

item.title: Workers who have recovered find a place aboard cruise ship
item.description:
May 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Foreign workers who have recovered from Covid-19 have started moving onto the cruise ship SuperStar Gemini, one of several temporary options before more permanent arrangements can be made to house them.

item.title: A Covid-19 lexicon
